it is located on the mountainous area of Llibela and it is one of the eleven rock hewn  churches of Llibela. there is a water under the rock floor of the church this is the most amazing thing of my life

Review Head: Another must see of the churches.
Review Body: Do not miss this church.  You have to travel by van to see it but it is worth it.  I was intrigued by the history of this particular church...

Review Head: You need to make the trip to this place!
Review Body: Just the road trip alone through the countryside is worth it, until you reach this amazing Monastery in a cave. Very peacful & full of history.

Review Head: Church in a Cave with Dead Bodies
Review Body: It's a bit of a ride and an uphill hike but worth it to visit this cave church with 10,000 mummified bodies in it. If you're into that sort of thing....fascinating!

Since we only had 2 days in Lalibela, our agent (Travel Ethiopia) included Yemrehanna Christos in our package. The drive out is an enjoyable experience despite the roadworks, which should be finished in a few months. We don't get sick of the countryside here. 
Once...

Please take the time to travel here from Lalibela!  The hour drive on a rough road is stunning and so interesting!  The walk up to the cave is beautiful.  This was certainly a highlight for our family.  On a side note- while traveling to Yemrehanna...

I was lucky enough to be able to visit this although it wasn't on the itinerary of the group trip I was on (it should be).

It was a bit of a climb up 100? Steps but on a well maintained path and not difficult....

Review Head: An Intense Climb to an Intense Church Complex
Review Body:
Beware...this church is big with people who have afflictions. You'll see lots of blind, deaf, disfigured people and most of them beg...but not in an aggressive way.

The church is built inside of a cave and the atmosphere is intense. Make sure to stop in...

This is a 1 1/2 hr drive from lalibella town. Theres a walk up to this church and at altitude may cause some travellers to get a bit breathless. Worth the visit, lovely old church. The corpses of pilgrims lie in the cave behind the...

Review Head: sine qua non for visitors in Ethiopia
Review Body:
The long trip we have enjoyed very much (being Greek we have in our DNA experiences with trips to Ithaca :).
the church is Evocative, most representtaive of the country.
The small shops and the people at the start of the uphill road is a...
after 2 hours of tuff road (but will be ok quite soon, they are building already roads) you arrive in a small village. you will need to walked during 15-20 minutes to see this beautiful monastry.

A nice walk up a steep hill,led to the cool cave and the grave of King Lalibela! Tree limbs hid the cave and created a mysterious atmosphere.  An authentic place to visit

Review Head: A steep climb to access the site!
Review Body: From the car park, it takes about 20 minutes to walk up to the church - and it's steep!  It's worth it, though, to see a church which was built before those in Lalibela itself and which probably provided the blueprint for them.
This is well worth the drive and if you have at least 2 nights in Lalibela you should include this very beautiful and less visited church
It's very far from lalibela.(About 41km and unpaved road). So many travelers skip this amazing cave church. But I think Yemrehanna Kristos is most beutiful church in Lalibela. It's really amazing!

A great day trip from Lalibela.  A very friendly priest and take a torch to walk to the back of the cave and see the remains on hundreds of pilgrims.

Review Head: hidden treasure of the mysterious ethiopia

Review Head: Unexpected gem hidden in a large cave

Review Head: Completely unique but difficult to get there
Review Body:
This church is really unique, but it is 42 kilometers away from Lalibela

Review Head: A good option, if you have additional half-day on your hands

Located about an hour and a half from Lalibela and built by King Lalibela's Uncle, an amazing church built in a cave in the middle of nowhere

Review Head: very different from the rest of the Lalibela churches
Review Body: worth a 40-km drive from Lalibela.  Unique cave monastery with a layer-cake design.  Stop in the village below for some coffee and injera afterwards
You have  to go out of the town to see this but it is well worth it.   The church is built entirely in a cave.

A beautiful church, older than the ones in Lalibela and protected from the elements as it is located in a cave. However, if there is no electricity there is little to see inside unless you bring your solar powered lamp. Recommended

Review Head: Worth the trek out of Lalibela
Review Body:
One of the most interesting and beautiful cave churches I've seen. Set about an hour and half outside of Lalibela but the roads are not too bad for Ethiopia. You'll have to avoid the standard amount of donkeys. 

There's also about a 15 minute walk...

I was lucky to be in Lalibela for the Orthodox Christmas because it meant there were a lot of pilgrims and services, although that also meant loads of people. However, this church was quieter and much less crowded. Very few tourists, as well. The road...

Review Head: check out surrounding area as well
Review Body: Went at end of rainy season - rivers in full flow and green valleys. Take some time taking in views and in village below.

Review Head: Don't Go All the Way To Ethiopia and Not See This
Review Body: You start with a beautiful, if rough, drive from Lalibela down into a spectacular valley. The church itself is built into a cave that is a brisk climb up the side of a mountain. There are stairs and guardrails, so it's not too difficult, but...

This place is under-rated and under-promoted and under-advertised. 
It's 45 KM outside of Lalibella, you need a car to get there. Hire a driver and go. You won't regret it. 
90 minute drive from Lalibella. From the point where the car drops you off, it...
This extraordinary monastery is built in the cleft of a rock and predates the Lalibela churches. Well worth the effort and expense of a visit, the journey through countryside fascinates as well

The church with its antiquity to 6th Century is worth the visit with little difficulty in ascending included .
Indeed the construction in a big mountain cave and the materials of marble and wood make it a unique Church to visit .With pilgrims making ascend...

We walked down to Yemrehanna from Tigue Kabila about 6 hours east of the cave church. Feeling like a knackered pilgrim  it was a pleasant relief to enter the cool of the cave, and to be confronted with what I thought to be the most...
About an hour's drive from Lalibela, this is a very striking site. The building combines wood and stone and is tucked into a cave on a wooded mountain-side

This church, built in an enormous cave in the 11th Century is a masterpiece - and formed the pattern for the unique Ethiopian style of rock-hewn churches (hewn down into the ground) that were created over the next few hundred years.  But more than that,...

Review Head: Alittle out of the way but worth the trip

Excelent trip from Lalibela, around 1h away (60km) through the typical ethiopian villages. The monastery itself is full of history and tradition with its mumified bodies around. Extraordinary compliment to Lalibela churches

Review Head: great drive, nice walk and impressive church.
Review Body: This church in a cave is reached after a long drive from lalibella and a short climb over a good walking path. The church is impressive and absolutely worth visiting.

Nice place to go slightly out of town of Lalibela. It took about one hour to drive on a newly improved dirt road.  The drive was worth the excursion. Of course, seeing the Church, beautifully preserved inside its cave home was wonderful.

Review Head: Well worth a visit and different to Laziness

Well worth the effort though a long rough road. Then you climb up through juniper and olive groves to the entrance.You take your shoes off to enter and flea powder liberally sprinkled on your socks beforehand a good idea!
A beautiful church despite the horrid...

Although the drive out is 40km, even before you get to the church you've had quite a view - seeing the scenery and all of the local villages on the way to the church was an experience in itself.

Once you are at the church...

Yemrehanne Kirstos church is located 42 km south of Lalibela on a rough road but the beauty of the area, the architecure of the church and the peace of the area is wonderful. I recommend people to visit it if they have a half day...
but well worth it.  Its façade is marred by an unsightly wall at the entrance of the church but other than that, it is incredible.

Jewel like colours Iconic ceiling of winged angels . Lovely paintings. Guide helps explaining the meanings.

Review Head: Take your time - its painter did ...

If you are in Gondar do not miss this church - not far to walk from the town and very interesting. It is something so beautiful and not to be missed
A brief visit will suffice and the ceiling is well worth the trip. The rest is as usual.Everyone seemed friendly.
Inside fully painted with biblical sceneries, rich in color and expression as well as symbolism. Must see.
This 18th-century church is famed for its ceiling frescoes. Our guide – spent much time explaining them. Visiting here on Sunday, there were lots and lots of churchgoers.
We are so lucky to be seeing these churches. What wonderful artists. The angel faces are wide eyed with wings and just what you have been hoping to see for years!

The interior of the church is covered with ecclesiastical paintings. This includes the ceiling which is fantastic. This is the oldest surviving church in Gonder as a result of the Mahdi invation in the 19th century. Not to be missed.

Definitely worth a visit while in Gondar! The paintings inside are beautiful. Don't forget to look up, the ceiling is amazing! If you've already done some church visits in Ethiopia, a guide shouldn't be necessary. However, if this is your first visit to an Ethiopian...

Review Head: A definitive must-see for Ethiopia in Gondar
Review Body: Lived for 6 months in Gondar & couldn't get enough of this church. It's an amazing JEWEL in an otherwise eclectic city. Be ready to pay for entrance and 'tour' - but worth it to learn the intricacies of the artwork. Ladies, PLEASE WEAR  HEAD...

This is worth the visit for a photo of the ceiling alone. It could have been painted yesterday! It was uncrowded, which was good :)

A beautifully painted roof of angels.  remember that these places, which are sometimes busy with tourist folk (often like ourselves), are actually vibrant places of worship.  Try to find a few moments of quiet, and reflect upon the meaning of this beautiful place.
A good intro to the bible story wall paintings used to instruct the worshipers. The church is in a walled compound.
This was a beautiful authentic Ethiopian church which is quite different from churches you see elsewhere. We liked it.

We were in Gondar during timkat, and visiting this church was great break
 from frantic events in town Located on a quiet hillside, it fascinates architecture and frescoes. Especially a ceiling, painted with angels that you can see across Ethiopia. Even my favorite beer, Habesha,...

Most people arrive by taxi or bajaj, but it's a...

This Church is amazing, be sure that the guide will explain you very well all the inside draws. This is a quiet place.

The ceiling in this building is the most amazing thing. It’s fully painted with angels staring in all directions. It has mostly been restored, so the colors are vivid. The walls of this church are fully painted with scenes from the Bible and of local...

Loved this Orthodox church with all its painted interior and fine ceiling - take a torch for best effect.

Glorious frescoes inside (check out the ceiling, particularly). A friendly priest sits inside most times.

Review Head: Nice surroundings and nice paintings - average compare to other attractions
Review Body: If you are in Gonder and have time, visit the place especially for its surroundings, Ethiopia is blessed with so many amazing attractions and this church is definitely not among the top 30

Not sure what to expect, this 17th century Orthodox Church is amazing! Being able to hear about the Church, and see the artwork was a terrific experience.

This church is one of the most beautiful church i have visited in Ethiopia. it has got beautiful painting on the cieling and all the wall which dated back to 16th century as the local guide told us. but there is poor management the compound...

great to see this famous ceiling. Small but beautiful. Part of good tour arranged by hikeinethiopia tours. Combine with the castle and the baths for good day sightseeing.
this church was really fascinating all the painting are old but well preserve and really attractive if you have time in Gondar worth to visit this church!

This church is one of the beautiful churche in Ethiopia and has got an old paintings which really cant believe in your eys.i have been visited other churches in Ethiopia but i found it this one is more beautiful one!
worth to visit if you...

Inside and out are amazing... Why don't we make building's in this standard.  Must see ...it's not that far from the city and airport suprisingly...BUT take a guide or tour do not travel in this region aimlessly or do your own touring. NO !

This is a must see.  Spend the time with a guide to find out more about this amazing church.  The grounds around are a haven for wildlife as well.
This is a beautiful church in a great setting. The paintings inside are very good and the ceiling is exceptional. While not large, it is well worth the visit.

In Gonder there still have only 4 church’s , in the past it was around 40, the others were destroyed furring the Soudan war

The church is still in use. there are separate entrances for men and women (ladies,...
Fabulous, even though it was the second time we visited. We were made to feel very welcome by local people who were praying. Ladies don’t forget to take a scarf to cover your head.
Remarkable church! A beautiful ceiling! Each face is different. A definite must when visiting Gondar.

Review Head: A religious experience in every sense

located in a very nice and quiet place, a few kilometers in the city. the paintings are unique and beautiful,

Being so old was constructed in rectangular form as Arch of Noe not as...

Review Head: Superb Entry, Outside, Inside and a Bird Sanctuary!

The walls and ceiling of this church are covered by extraordinary paintings. A ceiling fully covered by angel faces looking down at you is particularly charming..

Review Head: Age and appreciation of a unique christian history
Review Body:
I would recommend having a guide in this church as the murals would be lost had they not be pointed out and explained in detail.
The biggest surprise though on being in the gardens was the incredible diversity of bird life.

Review Head: One of the most interesting churches to see
Review Body: This church is historic and has some of the best interior artwork painted on the inside. The biblical stories are told in pictures and most are very vivid. We didn't have the guide, but instead there was another visitor inside that was explaining everything to...

Review Head: Beautifully painted church with the biblical stories told in pictures
Review Body: With a guide, this church provided a fascinating pictorial biblical history. Created for people unable to read, the church walls and ceiling provide a pretty comprehensive picture of the major Ethiopian Orthodox Religion. Loved the angels with the enormous eyes on the ceiling who are...

Review Head: Wait until you walk inside - wow!
Review Body: This church was part of our Gonder castle tour. From outside this church is interesting from a historical perspective, but otherwise just an old stone church. I was not expecting the paintings inside on the walls. Simply glorious!

This church was built a long time ago and it is still used for services today. The paintings on the walls and ceilings are impressive because they depict angels who sport afros and look Ethiopian. I enjoyed visiting this church just for those reasons alone.

Review Head: Well Preserved Ancient Church in Distinct Style
Review Body: The functioning church is still maintained to pretty good conditions which unique Noah Ark style. The ecclesiastical paintings were also interesting with distinct style from other orthodox fresco. Well worth a visit as the place is symbolic of an glorious era of Ethiopia.

Visited this as part of a tour which included Royal Enclosure - it was well worth having a guide as it takes the hassle out of trying to find your way around 
A great end to the trip I was on
Beautiful church with amazing paintings. Worth a visit. Nice little coffee shop opposite which is worth popping into afterwards.

Really enjoyed looking around this church. Our guide told us that this is the the only Gondarine church that remained untouched throughout the attack by the dervish of Sudan. According to legend, the church was saved by an intervention of bees. This is one of...

Review Head: We enjoyed this church but it was the first of many other churches so we got churched out
Review Body:
Women have a separate entrance from men as is so often the case in these chuches.
This one sits well in its surrounding and we were please that we had a good guide to explain things.

As usual the grounds could do with some up...

Review Head: Best ancient Church church in Gonder

This was last of our historical churches in Lalibela / Gondar area. Stunningly beautiful and so well preserved. Love to go back again

Review Head: Great things come in small packages

This is a nice side visit in Gonder. The ceiling is just awesome and makes it well worth it. The paintings remind us why Ethiopia is so unique. Friendly Priest is an added bonus.

This might have been my favorite church so far. The murals on the inside of the church are well preserved and beautiful. Go an hour or two before sunset. The light hits the inside of the church at the perfect angle. This is important since...

wonderful church with beautiful sceneries and paintings 
probably one of the best in the country; must be visited

Review Head: Beautiful circa 17th century Ethiopian church and vultures!

The artwork in this church is stunning - a must see for anyone visiting the area. The colours are so vibrant, and the impressions so vivid.

Qusquam was the last flower of Gondar before glory of the city wilted due to court...

This is a must go location in Gonder. The interior walls of this ancient but in use church and World Heritage Site are filled with paintings of stories from the bible. Breathtaking.
